TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit XhtmlPageAdapter extends System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlControlAdapter implements class System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IControlAdapter, class System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IPageAdapter

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")

Docs.summary: Provides a page adapter for the XHTML adapter set. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter> class inherits the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlControlAdapter> class and implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IPageAdapter> class.

Docs.permission: for verifying at load time that the class derived from has this permission. Associated enumerations: , .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the class. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

Gets a list of any additional HTTP headers by which caching is varied. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: An object of additional HTTP headers.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter> class inherits the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter.CacheVaryByHeaders%2A> property from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IPageAdapter> interface and always returns `null`.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the current cookieless property data, if any. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: An containing key/value pairs for the current cookieless data, if any; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter.CookielessDataDictionary%2A> property is populated when a valid <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> interface is configured as an attribute of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControlsSection> element.

Docs.summary: Returns the postback data collection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.returns: A object containing all query string or form parameters and values.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Because some devices handle postback differently from others, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter.DeterminePostBackMode%2A> method allows the adapter to modify the collection.

Docs.summary: Gets the key for submitting the event argument. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If an inheriting adapter overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter.EventArgumentKey%2A> property, it must also override the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter.DeterminePostBackMode%2A> method to process the postback.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If an inheriting adapter overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter.EventSourceKey%2A> property, it must also override the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter.DeterminePostBackMode%2A> method to process the postback.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool HandleError (Exception e, System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter writer);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool HandleError(class System.Exception e, class System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter writer) cil managed

Docs.summary: Called if an unhandled error occurs on the page. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks An adapter can choose to handle the error and display an error message. The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter> class does nothing and returns `false`.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool HandlePagePostBackEvent (string eventSource, string eventArgument);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool HandlePagePostBackEvent(string eventSource, string eventArgument) cil managed

Docs.param: The source identifier for the event.
Docs.summary: Indicates whether the adapter handles the postback event. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter.HandlePagePostBackEvent%2A> method is called during postback. An adapter can choose to handle the event. The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter> class does not handle the postback event and always returns `false`.

block.para: When overriding the method in a derived class, if you want your page adapter to handle the postback event, return after handling the event.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void InitWriterState(class System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter writer) cil managed

Docs.summary: Configures the object for the target device. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter.InitWriterState%2A> method is called before rendering the page. This method sets the following properties on `writer` for the target device:
- <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.UseDivsForBreaks%2A>
- <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.SuppressNewLine%2A>
- <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.SupportsNoWrapStyle%2A>

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void OnPreRender(class System.EventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.summary: Sets conditional pagination for the page. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter.OnPreRender%2A> method checks the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage.ActiveForm%2A> property for the page. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Form.Action%2A> property is not empty, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Panel.Paginate%2A> property for the active form is set to `false`. The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter.OnPreRender%2A> method calls the base <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.ControlAdapter.OnPreRender%2A> method before exiting.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.Form%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property inherits from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Panel?displayProperty=fullName> class, which provides the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Panel.Paginate%2A> property.

block.para: When overriding the method in a derived class, be sure to call the base method.

Docs.summary: Gets a page weight that is appropriate for the target device. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: An integer that represents the optimal number of bytes for a page on the target device.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void RenderUrlPostBackEvent (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter writer, string target, string argument);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void RenderUrlPostBackEvent(class System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter writer, string target, string argument) cil managed

Docs.param: An object that writes the link.
The name of the event for which the link is substituting.
Docs.summary: Creates a link on the current page to enable postback on devices that do not support postback events. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Some devices are able to execute a postback event on a link or button only. The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter.RenderUrlPostBackEvent%2A> method writes a link with a URL that contains all of the information that is required to process the form and to update and display the page.
